revised_title: Observations on the Maturation of the Ovum in the Guinea-Pig
tldr: This study investigates the maturation process of the ovum in guinea-pigs, focusing on the formation of polar bodies and the development of gemini within the nucleus. The researchers observe that the number of chromosomes in some eggs exceeds the expected somatic number, and discuss possible reasons for this phenomenon. They also describe a process of parthenogenetic segmentation in some eggs, which eventually leads to degeneration.
